post.description:
Creates or updates contacts in real-time. Details >.
The guide on bulk contact uploading and updating is available at the link.
Request example.

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 200 requests per 1 second.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting a contact identified by externalCustomerId.

parameters.name: erase
parameters.description: Permanent deletion of all contact data: contact profile attributes, contact activity, web- and mobile tracking. It is not possible to recover deleted data.

post.description:
The method is used for the integration of subscription forms.
If a contact does not exist, it is created with the non-confirmed email.
If a contact exists, the contact fields are updated (except existing media channels).
New contacts are created with a not confirmed status.

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 200 requests per 1 second.

get.description:
Search for contacts. The method returns max 500 results.
The total amount of contacts is in the TotalCount header.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description:
The number of the first contact returned in the search results.
Numbering starts at 1

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Possible value is 'contactId'. Only actual for searches without conditions. By default, the date of contact update is used for the search.
If this parameter is used, sorting is done by contactId. Using this parameter allows you to upload contacts faster.

post.description: The method adds new contacts and updates existing contacts. Asynchronous processing is used; requests may be handled in a different order or concurrently.

429.description: Too many requests: More than 200 requests per 1 second

post.description: The method is used to import or update the contacts from an external file. The method creates new contacts and updates existing ones.

get.description: The method is used for getting the status of the contact import session by the asynchronous ID of the session.
The method is used for getting the email addresses of contacts by their contactID.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma separated contact IDs to get email addresses for

post.description: The method is used for adding email addresses to the list of unsubscribed contacts.
The method is used for removing email addresses from the list of unsubscribed contacts.

get.description: The method is used to search for all contacts in a segment.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description:
The index of the first contact returned from the search result.
Numbering starts at 1

parameters.name: maxrows
parameters.description: Maximum number of contacts to return (max. 500)

parameters.name: orderByTs
parameters.description: Order by the time of addition to the segment.

parameters.name: asc
parameters.description: Sort in ascending (ASC) or descending (DESC) order.

post.description: The method deletes contacts from a static segment by contact ids or external customer ids. If don't specify any ids, all contacts will be deleted from the segment.
Attach contact to static segment by contact ids or external customer ids

get.description: The method searches for and returns the available segments.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description:
The index of the first segment returned from the search result.
Numbering starts at 1

parameters.name: maxrows
parameters.description: Maximum number of segments to be returned (max. 500)

get.description: The method searches for and returns the available workflows.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description:
The index of the first workflow returned from the search result.
Numbering starts at 1

parameters.name: maxrows
parameters.description: Maximum number of workflows to be returned (max. 500)

get.summary: Get contact ID by Mobile Push token
get.description: The method is used for getting the ID of a contact using the Mobile Push token ID.
The method is used for getting the names of categories a contact subscribed for.

put.description: The method is used for updating the categories that a contact subscribed for.

get.description: The method returns the available information about the contact identified by the contact ID.

put.description:
The method is used to update the contact's data, except for the contact ID field.
In case of updating a deleted contact, this contact is restored.

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 200 requests per 1 second.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting a contact identified by contactID.

parameters.name: erase
parameters.description: Permanent deletion of all contact's data: contact profile attributes, contact activity, web- and mobile tracking. It is not possible to recover the deleted data.

get.summary: Contact recommendations based on web tracking
get.description:
The method returns recommendations for a contact based on the web tracking.
NOTE: Version 2 API methods do not require escaping in nested JSON.

parameters.name: dataSourceId
parameters.description: Data Source ID. To find it, go to your account> Settings> Data Sources

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: Contact ID. At least one of contactId, email, phone, externalCustomerId, webId must be specified

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Contact email. At least one of contactId, email, phone, externalCustomerId, webId must be specified

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Contact phone number. At least one of contactId, email, phone, externalCustomerId, webId must be specified

parameters.name: externalCustomerId
parameters.description: External Customer ID. At least one of contactId, email, phone, externalCustomerId, webId must be specified

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: Web ID. At least one of contactId, email, phone, externalCustomerId, webId must be specified

parameters.name: products
parameters.description: Array of product IDs. Required for the product-based algorithms

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Category ID. Required for the category-based algorithms

get.description: The method returns a list of catalogs. A catalog contains the list of additional fields available for contacts in your organisation.

The method is used to search for Email messages using a part of their name or a tag. By default, a rate limit of 500 requests per hour applies.
The method returns a maximum of 500 messages per request.
The TotalCount header contains the number of messages returned to the query.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search condition (a part of the message name or a tag)

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description:
The index of the first message to return from the search result.
Numbering starts at 1

parameters.name: maxrows
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return (max. 500).

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 500 requests per 1 hour.

post.description: The method is used for adding/updating the language version of a message identified by the internal ID (for multilingual messages).

get.description:
This method is used to get a link to view the Email message.
 By default, a rate limit of 500 requests per hour applies.

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 500 requests per 1 hour.

post.description:
The method is used for sending a prepared message to one or many contacts. You can create broadcasts for Email, SMS, Mobile Push, Web Push, Viber, Telegram bot channels.
You can parametrize the message for each contact individually.

get.description: The method is used for getting the status of a single message.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: ID of sent message. This field is present if message was successfully queued for sending.

post.description: The method is used for sending an Email message to a contact. A new contact is created if no contact with such email address exists.

get.description:
The method returns the content, title, and sender details of a message identified by the internal ID â€“ html and css separately.
 By default, a rate limit of 500 requests per hour applies.

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 500 requests per 1 hour.

put.description: The method is used for updating the basic Email message.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting the basic Email message.

put.description: The method is used for updating or adding language versions for the basic Email message.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description:
Email message language code
In compliance with ISO_639-1

delete.description: The method is used for deleting the translation of the basic Email message.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Email message language code in compliance with ISO_639-1

get.description:
The method is used to search for Mobile Push messages using a part of name or a tag. By default, a rate limit of 500 requests per hour applies
The method returns a maximum of 500 messages per request.
The TotalCount header contains the number of messages returned by the query

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search condition (part of the message name or a tag)
parameters.example: You added items to your cart

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: Index of the first returned message from the search results. Numbering starts at 1

parameters.name: maxrows
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return (not more than 500)

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 500 requests per 1 hour.

post.description: The method is used for creating new Mobile Push message.

get.description:
The method returns Mobile Push message including language versions.
 By default, a rate limit of 500 requests per hour applies.

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 500 requests per 1 hour.

put.description: The method is used for updating the base Mobile Push message.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting the base Mobile Push message.

put.description: The method is used for updating or adding language versions for the basic Mobile Push message.

delete.summary: Delete language version of Mobile Push message
delete.description: The method is used for deleting the language version of the base Mobile Push message.

get.description:
The method is used to search for Viber messages using a part of name or a tag. By default, a rate limit of 500 requests per hour applies.
The method returns a maximum of 500 messages per request.
The TotalCount header contains the number of messages returned by the query

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search condition (part of the message name or a tag)
parameters.example: You added items to your cart

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: Index of the first returned message from the search results. Numbering starts at 1

parameters.name: maxrows
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return (not more than 500)

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 500 requests per 1 hour.

post.description: The method is used for creating base Viber message.

400.description:
Bad request:
  • Request body is empty.
  • Required field is absent: name, from, text.
  • Non-existing sender name used in message.
  • Used sender does not support specified transactional mode.
  • Not applicable field in transactional message: img, caption or action.
  • One or two of fields specified: img, caption or action; but not all three.

get.description:
The method returns Viber message found by ID.
 By default, a rate limit of 500 requests per hour applies.

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 500 requests per 1 hour.

put.description: The method is used for updating base Viber message.

400.description:
Bad request:
  • Request body is empty.
  • Required field is absent: name, from, text.
  • Non-existing sender name used in message.
  • Used sender does not support specified transactional mode.
  • Not applicable field in transactional message: img, caption or action.
  • One or two of fields specified: img, caption or action; but not all three.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting base Viber message.

put.description: The method is used for updating language version of base Viber message.

The method returns the App Inbox message found using its ID.
 By default, a rate limit of 500 requests per hour applies.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting the base Telegram bot message.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting the language version of the basic Telegram bot message.

put.description:
The method is used for receiving the status of a Mobile Push message using interaction_id.
This ID is sent along with data in a Mobile Push message.
Example: "es_interaction_id": "2E2E831C-486C-41F9-8E8D-BCD6B7A51A7A".

get.description:
The method returns content, title, sender and text of an SMS identified by its internal SMS message ID.
 By default, a rate limit of 500 requests per hour applies.

Too many requests:
  • More than 500 requests per 1 hour.

put.description: The method is used for updating the base SMS message.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting the base SMS message.

put.description: The method is used for updating the language version of SMS message.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting the language version of the basic SMS message.

post.description: The method is used for sending an SMS message to a contact. A new contact is created if no contact with such phone number exists.

get.description:
The method is used to search for SMS messages using a part of their names or a tag. By default, a rate limit of 500 requests per hour applies.
The method returns a maximum of 500 messages per request.
The TotalCount header contains the number of messages returned by the query.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search condition (a part of the message name or a tag)

429.description:
Too many requests:
  • More than 500 requests per 1 hour.

post.description: The method is used for creating basic SMS messages.
The method is used for sending a Viber message to a contact. A new contact is created if no contact with such phone number exists.

get.description: The method is used for getting a list of broadcasts.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description:
Index of the first message to return from search results
Numbering starts at 1

parameters.name: maxrows
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return (maximum 500)

post.description: The method is used for creating broadcasts for Email, SMS, Mobile Push, Web Push, Viber, Telegram channels.

get.description: The method is used for getting broadcast information.

delete.description: The method is used for cancelling a scheduled broadcast.

get.description: The method is used for getting SMS interfaces (alpha names).
The method is used for getting Email interfaces (sender names).
The method returns a list of all available promotional codes as JSON string.

parameters.name: inUse
parameters.description: When 'true', the promo code has been used, when 'false', the promo code has not been used

parameters.name: activeDueDays
parameters.description:
The days left for promo codes to remain active
(activeDueDays=7 means: the promo code remains active for the following 7 days, starting from tomorrow)

parameters.name: discount
parameters.description: Discount received with the promo code

post.summary: Upload promotional codes in JSON format
post.description:
The method is used for uploading promo codes from a JSON file.
Existing promotional codes are updated.

get.summary: Get the number of available promotional codes
get.description: The method returns the number of available promo codes.

parameters.name: activeDueDays
parameters.description:
The number of days left for the promo codes to remain active
(activeDueDays=7 means the promo code remains active during the next 7 days, starting from tomorrow)

get.description: The method returns subscription categories for the organization.
The method is used for retrieving the preprocessor file uploading session status using the asynchronous session identifier.

post.description: The method is used for uploading a file for the preprocessor from an external repository.

The methods updates the data of a preprocessor file uploaded using the Upload file for preprocessor method.
To update the file, use the fileId value returned by the Upload file for preprocessor method in its response.

The method is used for generating events in the account to be used for starting a workflow or being taken into account for segmentation.
Max. size of content for events sent in the request body is 20 kB.
To learn more, read Order management via events.

The method is used for transferring the available event data from your CRM or other data store to our system.
The workflows are not launched for these events. You can send up to 500 events per a request.
Learn more.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting events occurred during selected period.

post.description:
Sends any backend events from websites and mobile apps to our system. Secure for sensitive data.For sending frontend events, mobile apps should use SDK.The request example is available at the link.
  • NOTE: The maximum size of event data in the request body is 20 KB.

The method is used for transferring the available event data from your CRM or other data store to our system.
Workflows are not launched for these events. You can send up to 500 events per a request.
NOTE: Version 2 API methods do not require escaping in nested JSON.
Learn more.

The method is used for generating a token for bearer authentication. Use the token only if the basic authentication is not appropriate for you.
Available methods for token authorization:
POST /v1/event
POST /v1/past_events
DELETE /v1/past_events

get.description: The method returns the account name.
The method returns the balance for the account.
The method returns the billing history of the account.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description:
The initial date for the billing history. The date values are passed in the ISO_8061 format.
Date format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description:
The end date for the billing history. The date values are passed in the ISO_8061 format.
Date format: YYYY-MM-DD

400.description: dateTo must be greater or equal to dateFrom

419.description: Request period must be not greater than 90 days

post.description:
The method is used for transferring orders.
To learn more, read Order Transfer Using the Generate event API Method.

get.description: The method returns the contact activity on subscriptions.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: Initial date and time of the period you want to get the contact activity for

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: Final date and time of the period you want to get the contact activity for

parameters.name: activityStatus
parameters.description: Activity status (DELIVERED, UNDELIVERED, READ, UNSUBSCRIBED, CLICKED, SPAM)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Last found contact activity offset in previous search results. It is used to continue search

parameters.name: maxrows
parameters.description: Max number of activity entries in response

get.description:
The method returns the contact's message history.
Supported media types: Email, SMS, Viber, Mobile Push, Web Push, App Inbox, Telegram.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description:
The initial date or date and time of the history period. The date/time values are passed in the ISO_8061 format.
Date format: YYYY-MM-DD
Date with time format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description:
The final date or date amd time of the history period. The date/time values are passed in the ISO_8061 format.
Date format: YYYY-MM-DD
Date with time format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Contact's email address (either contactId, or externalCustomerId, or email, or phone number must be specified)

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Contact's phone number (either contactId, or externalCustomerId, or email, or phone number must be specified)

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: Contact ID number (either contactId, or externalCustomerId, or email, or phone number must be specified)

parameters.name: externalCustomerId
parameters.description: External Customer ID (either contactId, or externalCustomerId, or email, or phone number must be specified)

parameters.name: channelTypes
parameters.description: Comma separated list of user messages channel types that will be included to the response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset from the first item. For pagination purposes

parameters.name: maxrows
parameters.description: Max number of items in the response. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 100

get.description: The method returns activity status of the mobile token: {"active":true} or {"active":false}.

put.description: The method is used for changing activity status of the mobile token.

post.description: The method is used for adding application tokens.
The method mutes notifications to Telegram users having tokens. Read more.

400.description:
Bad Request:
  • Wrong app uuid
  • Token must be specified
  • Duration must be positive integer

post.description: The method unmutes notifications to Telegram users having tokens. Read more.

400.description:
Bad Request:
  • Wrong app uuid
  • Token must be specified

get.description: The method returns your organization's domain. The response is empty if no domain is found.

post.description:
The method registers the domain sent in the body params for use in web tracking or widgets.
Only one domain can be registered per organization.

get.description:
The method returns the script for your account.
The domain must exist for an organization before getting a script.
It can be used for plugins that automatically install the script on the site and require the API endpoint for getting the script.
The method returns the list of domains registered for web push notifications.

post.description: The method is used for adding a domain for web push notifications.

delete.description: The method is used for deleting a domain for web push notifications.

get.description: The method returns the web push script for the specified domain.

The list of contacts that can not be added/updated.
If 1 element is found, failedContacts is an object; if multiple elements are found, failedContacts is an array.

asyncSessionId.description: Asynchronous import session ID. Used to obtain the import status using the /v1/importstatus method.

ContactBulkUpdateResult.description: The result of multiple contacts adding/updating.

firstName.description: The contactâ€™s first name. Numbers are not allowed.

lastName.description: The contactâ€™s last name. Numbers are not allowed.

Catalog id.

The list of contacts that can not be added/updated.
If 1 element is found, failedContacts is an object; if multiple elements are found, failedContacts is an array.

contacts.description:
The list of contacts that will be added or updated (max. 3000).
If this array of objects contains externalCustomerId, the search uses externalCustomerId and ignores dedupeOn.

dedupeOn.description: The field for determining the contact uniqueness. Important the field set as dedupeOn will not be updated

fieldId.description:
The field for determining the contact uniqueness.
This field is taken into account when dedupeOnProperty has the fieldId value.

contactFields.description:
The list of contactsâ€™ fields to be updated. All the contact fields will be updated if this parameter is not specified.
The fields will be updated with the â€˜nullâ€™ value if no data for updating is transmitted.

items.description:
The list of contactsâ€™ fields to be updated. All the contact fields will be updated if this parameter is not specified.
The fields will be updated with the â€˜nullâ€™ value if no data for updating is transmitted.

customFieldsIDs.description:
The list of the custom field IDs to be updated.
The custom fields are updated if their IDs are in this list.
This field is required when a contact is updated

items.description:
The list of the custom field IDs to be updated.
The custom fields are updated if their IDs are in this list.
This field is required when a contact is updated

groupNames.description: The list of the segment names where the new/updated contacts will be added to.

items.description: The list of the segment names where the new/updated contacts will be added to.

groupNamesExclude.description: The list of the segment names where the new/updated contacts will be excluded from.

restoreDeleted.description: Choose either to restore the previously deleted contacts or not.

eventKeyForNewContacts.description:
The event type identification key. An event of corresponding type is generated for each contact.
If the system does not have an event type with such a key, a new event type is created.
All characters are allowed, except < ; â€™ \ / | " ` ' ^ ? ! , >
Max length: 100 symbols

batchSize.description: The broadcasting speed management parameterâ€”the number of messages per specified time interval

batchIntervalUnit.description: The broadcasting speed management parameterâ€”the time interval.

startDate.description: The broadcast start date. Use the following format: "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm". If not specified, the broadcast starts immediately

batchSize.description: The broadcasting speed management parameter, the number of messages per specified time interval.

batchIntervalUnit.description: The broadcasting speed management parameterâ€”the time interval.

domain.description: Broadcast domain. For web push messages.

appId.description: Application ID. For mob push and telegram messages.

dedupeOn.description: The property for determining the contact uniqueness.

link.description:
The link to a file in an external repository.
File Requirements:
Not empty
Delimiters - ","
Maximum size 100 MB
Requirement for column naming:
First name. The following rules apply to character usage:
- Max length: 40 symbols.
- Letters from any alphabet are allowed (Unicode characters).
- Three words longer than 3 characters and three words with a maximum of 3 characters are allowed.
- Up to 3 digits are allowed.
- Special characters are not allowed, except for:
-- Apostrophes ''Ê¼`Â´Ê¹Ê»Ê½Ê¾Ê¿ËˆËŠË®Ê¹Î„Õšá¾½á¾¿'â€›â€²â€µêž‹êžŒï¼‡ (only inside words)
-- Hyphen - (only inside words)
-- One dot at the end of words having max 3 characters. Example: Jr.
- Names consisting only of numbers and special characters are not allowed
Last name. The following rules apply to character usage:
- Max length: 40 symbols.
- Letters from any alphabet are allowed (Unicode characters).
- Three words longer than 3 characters and three words with a maximum of 3 characters are allowed.
- Up to 3 digits are allowed.
- Special characters are not allowed, except for:
-- Apostrophes ''Ê¼`Â´Ê¹Ê»Ê½Ê¾Ê¿ËˆËŠË®Ê¹Î„Õšá¾½á¾¿'â€›â€²â€µêž‹êžŒï¼‡ (only inside words)
-- Hyphen - (only inside words)
-- One dot at the end of words having max 3 characters. Example: Jr.
- Names consisting only of numbers and special characters are not allowed
Address
Region
City
Postcode
Email
SMS
Language code
Timezone
Contact ID
Additional info
The columns containing additional contact fields in a file shall be named: KEY_PROFILE.KEY_CUSTOMFIELD
The fields that are not found in the system remain empty (not updated).

fieldGroups.description:
The lists of additional fields assigned to this catalog.
If 1 element is found, fieldGroups is an object; if multiple elements are found, fieldGroups is an array.

addressBook.description: The list of catalogs. If 1 element is found, addressBook is an object, if multiple elements are found, addressBook is an array.

name.description: The name of additional fields group.

profileKey.description: The key of additional fields group.

fields.description: Fields. If 1 element is found, 'fields' will be an object; if multiple elements are found, 'fields' will be an array.

The lists of additional fields assigned to this catalog.
If 1 element is found, fieldGroups is an object; if multiple elements are found, fieldGroups is an array.

results.description: If 1 element is found, results will be an object; if multiple elements are found, results will be an array.

groupId.description: The group ID related to a subscription category.

dedupeValue.description: A value of the field used to determine the contact uniqueness.

DedupeMapping.description:
The list of contact IDs created/updated as a result of the import.
An array of "key" - "value" pairs, where the key is a contact field used to determine uniqueness, and the value is the contact ID.

status.description:
STARTED - import session in queue for processing.
IMPORTING - import session being processed at the moment.
FINISHED - import session completed successfully.
ERROR - error when processing import session.

timestamp.description: The status setting time in the ISO 8601 format.

mapping.description:
The list of contact IDs created/updated as a result of the import.
An array of "key" - "value" pairs, where the key is a contact field used to determine uniqueness, and the value is the contact ID.

status.description:
Email:

IN_QUEUE: Message is in queue for sending.
DELIVERED: Message is delivered.
UNDELIVERED: Message is not delivered.
BLACKLISTED: Email is in blacklist.
NOT_CONFIRMED: Email is not confirmed.
UNSUBSCRIBED: Unsubscribed email.
SPAM: Email is reported as spam.
READ: Message was read.
CLICKED: Contact clicked the links in the message.
NO_MONEY: Insufficient funds for sending.

ERROR: SMTP/ESMTP or other sending error.

SMS:

IN_QUEUE: Message is in queue for sending.
PENDING: Message was sent, but delivery confirmation has not been received yet.
DELIVERED: Message is delivered.
SMS_UNDELIVERED_STATE: Message is not delivered.
EXPIRED: Message status waiting time is over.
NO_MONEY: Insufficient funds for sending.

Viber:

IN_QUEUE: Message is in queue for sending.
PENDING: Message was sent, but delivery confirmation has not been received yet.
DELIVERED: Message is delivered.
READ: Message is read.
CLICKED: Contact clicked the links in the message.
VIBER_UNKNOWN_USER: Viber application is not installed on the mobile device.
VIBER_UNDELIVERED_STATE: Message is not delivered.
VIBER_EXPIRED_STATE: Message status waiting time is over.
NO_MONEY: Insufficient funds for sending.
Telegram:

DELIVERED: The message is delivered.
BOT_SEND_ERROR: The message is not delivered because the recipient has blocked it or the chat was not found.
CLICKED: The recipient followed the link in the message.

requestId.description: Message delivery identifier. Used for getting the status.

failed.description: When true, the message has not been delivered. The reason is in the status field.

delivered.description: When true, message has been delivered to the contact.

InstantMessageStatusDto.description: If 1 element is found, 'results' will be an object; if several elements are found, 'results' will be an array.

results.description: If 1 element is found, 'results' will be an object; if several elements are found, 'results' will be an array.

channelDetails.description: An array of data for each media channel

totalSent.description: The number of sent messages for a given day

totalParts.description:
The number of parts in sent messages
Relevant for SMS messages: they can contain one or more parts
For other media channels will be equal to totalSent.

fundsRefund.description:
Returned funds
May be relevant for SMS and/or Viber media channels

bonusReceived.description: Received prepaid messages. Accrued when subscription is connected/renewed

reservedFundsWithdrawal.description:
Debited reserved funds.
May be relevant for Viber media channel only

reservedFundsRefund.description:
Returned reserved funds.
May be relevant for Viber media channel only

ChannelCosts.description: An array of data for each media channel

groupId.description: The group ID related to a subscription category.

additionalProperties.description: Available balance by the media type and sender

sendersReservedBalances.description: Available balance by the media type and sender

SendersReservedBalance.description: Available balance by the media type and sender

duration.description:
Mute duration in seconds. If not set, notifications are muted permanently.
  • Minimum value: 5
  • Maximum value: 31,536,000 (approximately 1 year)

FailedOrders.description:
The list of orders that cannot be added or updated.
The possible reasons for an order to fail:
- One or more required fields are empty, or the format is incorrect.
- All of the following optional fields are empty: externalCustomerId, email, phone. At least one of them is required for order creation.

externalOrderId.description: ID of an order in the external system

externalCustomerId.description: External contact id. Required if email and phone are empty

email.description: Required if externalCustomerId and phone are empty

phone.description: Required if email and externalCustomerId are empty

storeId.description: Store ID (if you have several stores in one eSputnik account)

source.description: Online | offline values for segmentation. If the field is empty or some other value, by default the order will be accepted as online

externalItemId.description: Product ID in the external system

eventTypeKey.description:
Event type ID key. If no event type exists with this key, a new event is created.
All characters are allowed except < ; â€™ \ / | " ` ' ^ ? ! , >
Max length: 100 symbols

keyValue.description:
Event key. Determines event uniqueness.
The key must contain a unique value for each contact (for example, email, phone number, external contact id, etc.)
If this parameter is not set, params must contain one of the following contact identifiers:
- contactId
- externalCustomerId
- email
- phone
- pushToken: web or mobile
All characters are allowed except the following ones < ; â€™ \ / | " ` ' ^ ? ! , >
Max length: 300 symbols

params.description:
List of event parameters represented as an array of "key" - "value" pairs. The parameter keys are arbitrary.
Used in campaigns and for creating dynamic content in messages.

Parameter.description:
The list of event parameters represented as an array of "key" - "value" pairs. The parameter keys are arbitrary.
Used in campaigns and for creating dynamic content in messages.

time.description: The status change date and time in the YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ format

channels.description:
List of media channels.
You can add maximum two channels of the same type. It is necessary to specify at least one channel.

fields.description: The values of the contactâ€™s additional fields.

addressBookId.description:
Catalog ID.
You can get the value using the GET /v1/addressbooks method.
Optional parameter.

tags.description: Workflow tags. If 1 element is found, 'tags' will be an object; if multiple elements are found, 'tags' will be an array.

items.description: Workflow tags. If 1 element is found, 'tags' will be an object; if multiple elements are found, 'tags' will be an array.

locator.description: The message recipient email address or phone number.

status.description:
Results:
OK - success to queue the message for sending. Get the message status using requestId.
ERROR - failure to queue the message for sending.

requestId.description: ID of the sent message. The field is present when a message has been successfully queued for sending.

message.description: Error details. The field is present when the status is ERROR.

results.description: The list of results. This is an object when results contain a single element, and an array when results contain multiple elements.

from.description:
Sender address (enter one of the valid sender addresses).
Address format: "\"name\" <test@mail.com>"

plainText.description: Version of the message in plain text

items.description: The list of recipients

tags.description: The list of tags assigned to the message

items.description: The list of tags assigned to the message

externalRequestId.description: External request ID. It is the same for all the recipients

skipPersonalisation.description: Skip the application of personalization to the message

subscriptionsKeys.description: Array of subscription category keys added to the message

items.description: Array of subscription category keys added to the message

trackUrls.description: The parameter determines whether to track links in the message or not. The default value is â€˜trueâ€™

email.description:
Message type.
true for email, false for other media-channels.

fromName.description:
Sender name.
For email, indicate the sender name only, without an email address. The sender's email address selected in the message is used.
For SMS, use the alphanumeric sender ID.
If the parameter is not indicated, the sender name selected in the message is used.

contactId.description: Required parameter, if "locator" and "externalCustomerId" are not specified.

externalCustomerId.description: Required parameter, if "locator" and "contactId" are not specified.

locator.description:
Recipient's media-channel. Required parameter, if "contactId" and "externalCustomerId" are not specified.
For example: email-address for email messages; phone number for SMS or Viber; token for Web or Mob-push messages; chat_id for Telegram bot.

jsonParam.description: The set of parameters in JSON format. Used for the messages with the dynamic content.

languageCode.description: Desired message language for the contact. Used for the multilingual messages.

status.description:
ACCEPTED - the event added successfully to processing.
OCCURRED_DATE_IS_REQUIRED - no event occurrence date present.
INCORRECT_OCCURRED_DATE_FORMAT - incorrect date format.
OCCURRED_TIME_TOO_DEPTH - the event occurrence time is beyond the limit for the past.
OCCURRED_TIME_IN_FUTURE - the event occurrence time cannot be in the future.
EVENT_SEGMENTATION_DISABLED - the segmentation for this event is disabled. More info at How to use event segmentation
SERVER_ERROR - failure to put the message in the queue for sending.

if more than one sender is available.

formType.description:
The subscription form name. It allows you to use several independent subscription forms.
All characters are acceptable, except: < ; â€™ \ / | " ` ' ^ ? ! , >

SubscribeContact.description:
The method for double opt-in implementation. A created contact is unconfirmed.
It is impossible to send bulk emails to such contacts until they confirm their subscription; however, they are available for receiving important trigger messages.
An event will be automatically generated after this method is called.
Sending a confirmation email can be implemented using the mechanism of events and campaigns.
When clicking the link in the letter, a contact becomes confirmed and available for bulk emails sending.

channels.description: You can add maximum two channels of the same type. It is necessary to specify at least one channel.

activityStatus.description:
Activity status

DELIVERED - message delivered
UNDELIVERED - message not delivered
READ - message read
UNSUBSCRIBED - contact unsubscribed from mailing
SUBSCRIPTION_CHANGED - contact changed subscription categories
CLICKED - contact followed the links in the message
SPAM - contact complained about spam

statusDescription.description:
This field is returned only if the status is UNDELIVERED,
Contains the cause of the delivery failure.
This may be a response from the recipient's server, a system's response about inability to send the message, etc.

viewMessageLink.description: Contains a link to the message. For emails only.

clickEventLink.description: Contains the link clicked by the contact.

offset.description: Contains the bias result. Used to continue the previous search.

workflowInstanceId.description: The ID of a particular workflow launch.

messageId.description:
Message ID.
0 for test messages or those sent using the following methods:/v1/message/email /v1/message/sms /v1/message/viber

messageInstanceId.description:
ID of the message instance.
0 for test messages or those sent using the following methods: /v1/message/email /v1/message/sms /v1/message/viber
